newsitem.title: POLAND: Optimus rebounds 5.8 pct after plunge.
newsitem.headline: Optimus rebounds 5.8 pct after plunge.

text.p: Polish computer maker Optimus SA rose 5.8 percent to 119 zlotys in moderate trade after Wednesday's plunge, helped by the company's forecast of 1997 net profit rising 80 percent, traders said.

On Wednesday Optimus plunged 10 percent after it had denied the market rumour that Microsoft had bought most of its convertible bonds, which it said were bought by financial investors from Asia and Europe.
Optimus said on Tuesday it expected to lift net profit this year to 30 million zlotys from 16.5 million zlotys in 1996.
"The rise is a reaction after the fall, but it was helped by the net growth forecast for this year, which the market ignored yesterday after the Microsoft news," one trader said.
Some analysts said the stock might continue rising to between 160 and 200 zlotys in two or three months.
